post.body:
Jenna Marbles was a popular YouTuber 10 years ago. She was mostly known for videos like “how men drive” or “what women think about during sex” and they were actually funny videos. Of course, those videos are now considered offensive because gender doesn’t exist and there’s also 100 genders. No really, she made an apology video crying and took down her good videos. She went from actually being entertaining to making basic bitch make up videos. 

Amy Schumer, I’m sure everyone reading this hates her. You might not remember, but she was actually a decent comedian. I’m talking about the Comedy Central roast and her first few specials. Then the woke people got to her, and the substance of her new specials were nothing but political bullshit. She fell so hard that people started questioning if she funny in the first place. I sincerely believe she would have been fine if she didn’t go woke. 

Laura Clery, she started off funny then increasingly became more political. She used to make skits now she makes videos about “why breast feeding offensive, but twerking isn’t?” Then concludes it’s all the fault of straight males. Now it’s like every video she has is her crying on livestreams. If only she didn’t have a victim mentality. Breast feeding in public doesn’t make you Rosa Parks. 

There’s other examples of this. The main point is that telling a successful person that they’re a victim or that they’re offensive won’t help them. These woke people getting in their ears are harming them more than their imaginary straight white oppressor. It’s a damn shame that most female comedians get kidnapped and indoctrinated by the woke mob. Some have potential, but it’s like now we see a girl on stage and go “god damn, I hope she doesn’t talk about politics”. It wasn’t like that 10-15 years ago.

post.body:
It is a simple truth that has been accepted by all decent human beings for centuries. Trans woman should have the same rights as any other female, they should have the same rights as any other woman.
However, despite how true it may be and how much progress we've made in the past twenty four years, there was trans-exclusionary radical feminists who wanted to fight this fact tooth and nail, to prove that it was wrong. They wanted to deny it to everyone and anything else on planet Earth. And when trans people couldn't agree with them or get along, they would resort to violent acts to prove their point.
They'd pick up rocks and beat trans folk up for no apparent reason. Or if they did have a reason, they would throw those objects as hard as possible. It didn't matter which gender they were beating up. Sometimes even male trans men and enbys could be targeted as well. Some even died because of these actions.
We need to change the way we look at things! We need to make the world realize that TERFs don't belong here.
It's time to end this stupid argument about 'transgenderism' and accept what we truly are! A woman is a woman and she will always be one. Her biological sex has no bearing whatsoever on whether or not she is a girl or a boy. Her gender is what really matters and nothing more. That is why I'm proud to call myself a woman, because I am what I am. Not a man and not an ape, just me. And that is something that you can never take from me. Never forget that.
And I know many will disagree with me because some people will spread lies that are so blatantly false that we need a new generation of activists who want to bring the truth out into the open. Chuds, nazis and extremists alike will tell us to shut up and go back to hiding under our rock. Well tough luck because we're not going anywhere anytime soon. We'll stay right where we are and fight until our blood is red. Because we have a right to exist. The world owes us justice.
post.body_html: It is a simple truth that has been accepted by all decent human beings for centuries. Trans woman should have the same rights as any other female, they should have the same rights as any other woman. However, despite how true it may be and how much progress we've made in the past twenty four years, there was trans-exclusionary radical feminists who wanted to fight this fact tooth and nail, to prove that it was wrong. They wanted to deny it to everyone and anything else on planet Earth. And when trans people couldn't agree with them or get along, they would resort to violent acts to prove their point. They'd pick up rocks and beat trans folk up for no apparent reason. Or if they did have a reason, they would throw those objects as hard as possible. It didn't matter which gender they were beating up. Sometimes even male trans men and enbys could be targeted as well. Some even died because of these actions. We need to change the way we look at things! We need to make the world realize that TERFs don't belong here. It's time to end this stupid argument about 'transgenderism' and accept what we truly are! A woman is a woman and she will always be one. Her biological sex has no bearing whatsoever on whether or not she is a girl or a boy. Her gender is what really matters and nothing more. That is why I'm proud to call myself a woman, because I am what I am. Not a man and not an ape, just me. And that is something that you can never take from me. Never forget that. And I know many will disagree with me because some people will spread lies that are so blatantly false that we need a new generation of activists who want to bring the truth out into the open. Chuds, nazis and extremists alike will tell us to shut up and go back to hiding under our rock. Well tough luck because we're not going anywhere anytime soon. We'll stay right where we are and fight until our blood is red. Because we have a right to exist. The world owes us justice.

parent.body:
I upvoted because your opinion is genuinely unpopular here (fitting the guild), and because I believe it's good to have different types of people on this site. I wish people didn't use the rep buttons as agree/disagree options. 

That being said, I fundamentally disagree with you. Let's pick your argument apart. 

>It is a simple truth that has been accepted by all decent human beings for centuries.

The transgender movement has only existed since around the 1960's (coinciding with the publication of the Reimer twin experiment), and was extremely niche until *very* recent years - within the past decade. So no, it has not been accepted for centuries, because it's a modern idea. Please, respond to me with any one of your alleged historical examples of gender theory, and I'll explain why they aren't applicable. 

>Trans woman should have the same rights as any other female, they should have the same rights as any other woman.

Tell me, what does "rights" means in this context? The right to use the women's bathroom when you're biologically male? The right to compete in sports against people who have testosterone levels that are 100x lower than your own? The right to be referred to with pronouns that don't match your genitalia? I always find it silly when people are shouting about "trans rights", when none of the things they want are actual rights. Declaring something a right doesn't make it so. 

>They'd pick up rocks and beat trans folk up for no apparent reason. Or if they did have a reason, they would throw those objects as hard as possible. It didn't matter which gender they were beating up.

I'd just like to point out that, as much as I disagree with you, I would never advocate for violence against somebody because of how they behave, how they dress, what they believe in, etc. I don't think folks were *stoning* trans people back in the day, but if they were, that's horrible, and hopefully we're in a society now that doesn't allow for such senseless violence.

>Sometimes even male trans men and enbys could be targeted as well.

Please, for the love of God, *stop coming up with new terminology for your alphabet soup culture*. It seems like all the sudden, I've witnessed this huge spike in people referring to non-binary people as "enby", and asexual people as "ace". It's confusing enough already to folks who aren't absorbed in this gender theory nonsense - believe me. Just stick with the full words so most of us know what you're talking about. 

>It's time to end this stupid argument about 'transgenderism' and accept what we truly are!

If you accepted what you truly are, you'd be calling yourself a man right now. Sex and gender have always been interchangeable terms, and only recently did that change because of the woke mob. For me, the transgender debate is a definitional one. A man is a person with a penis / XY chromosomes and a woman is a person with a vagina / XX chromosomes. Intersex people and those with chromosomal disorders exist, yes, but that's not what we're talking about here, and *every single one* of those conditions has an associated sex with it, depending on the presence of an SRY gene and sensitivity to testosterone. 

If you want to dress up like a woman, that's fine. I may look at you funny, but I wouldn't *throw rocks at you* or anything. However, I won't treat you like a woman just because *your feelings* say that you're a woman. That would be delusional. 

>Because we have a right to exist.

You have the right to be delusional, but you don't have the right for people to accept your delusions. Please, get some psychological help. Behavioral therapy can effectively treat gender dysphoria. Rather than mutilating yourself with unnecessary surgeries and living a lifestyle that commonly results in suicide, let the experts help you sort your feelings out. **Accept yourself for who you are - a man.**

body:
Ah yes, the newest idol, complementarianism. Tell me, why do you not treat people differently on the basis of other attributes? There are a lot of things that affect a person far more profoundly than their sex. Why are someone's genitals so important to how you view them and treat them? Is there a real reason or is it just your primal instincts telling you to base everything in life around mating and reproduction?

And why do you think you're not allowed to interact with the sex you're attracted to in a non-sexual way?

guild.description: Got a burning unpopular opinion you want to share? Spark some discussions!
guild.description_html: Got a burning unpopular opinion you want to share? Spark some discussions!
guild.name: UnpopularOpinion

parent.body:
**Because men and women are different.** Neither one is lesser than another - they're complementary. I try not to treat people differently based on sex in the workplace, to maintain some professionalism, but outside the workplace it's fair game. I'm attracted to one sex and not attracted to another. That's enough to completely change my interactions with people at clubs, bars, etc. Men and women have different hormonal profiles, which results in different behaviors - this can also impact things. Finally, cultural norms do exist, and most people where I live adhere to them. It'd be difficult to simply ignore them. 

Really, what I was getting at there was pronoun usage (I won't use the incorrect pronoun for somebody just because they *feel* like the incorrect gender), but the rest also applies. A man in a dress with an inside-out penis is still a man, and I'll treat him like a man.

"For God so loved the world, that He gave His only begotten Son, that whoever believes in Him shall not perish, but have eternal life. For God did not send the Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world might be saved through Him. He who believes in Him is not judged; he who does not believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God. This is the judgment, that the Light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the Light, for their deeds were evil. For everyone who does evil hates the Light, and does not come to the Light for fear that his deeds will be exposed. But he who practices the truth comes to the Light, so that his deeds may be manifested as having been wrought in God."

May all personally encounter the presence and attention of the Lord God.

parent.body:
>Tell me, why do you not treat people differently on the basis of other attributes? There are a lot of things that affect a person far more profoundly than their sex.

I do. Sex is one of many factors. Of course, sex is one of the most prominent features, considering it impacts one's hormonal profile, skeletal structure, muscle mass, etc. It has far more of an impact than, say, race. What other attributes are you thinking of? Intelligence? Height? Personality? These are all valid answers, but it doesn't make sex any less important. 

>Why are someone's genitals so important to how you view them and treat them? Is there a real reason or is it just your primal instincts telling you to base everything in life around mating and reproduction?

Because different people are different and should be treated different. There's likely some deeply-rooted biological aspect to it, too, but I'd like to think it's more because one's disposition, personality, etc. impacts how others treat them. Men act different than women, and vice versa. Sure, there are exceptions - some men are more effeminate and some women are more masculine - but most traits (other than, say, one's sex) exist on a spectrum. Women on average tend to display certain traits while men display others. It's that simple. 

>And why do you think you're not allowed to interact with the sex you're attracted to in a non-sexual way?

I didn't say that. You're making a lot of assumptions here, and I get the impression that you're more interested in antagonizing me than having a productive conversation. If you disagree, by all means, but do it without falling into the "so what you're saying is" trap.

post.body:
It is a simple truth that has been accepted by all decent human beings for centuries. Trans woman should have the same rights as any other female, they should have the same rights as any other woman.
However, despite how true it may be and how much progress we've made in the past twenty four years, there was trans-exclusionary radical feminists who wanted to fight this fact tooth and nail, to prove that it was wrong. They wanted to deny it to everyone and anything else on planet Earth. And when trans people couldn't agree with them or get along, they would resort to violent acts to prove their point.
They'd pick up rocks and beat trans folk up for no apparent reason. Or if they did have a reason, they would throw those objects as hard as possible. It didn't matter which gender they were beating up. Sometimes even male trans men and enbys could be targeted as well. Some even died because of these actions.
We need to change the way we look at things! We need to make the world realize that TERFs don't belong here.
It's time to end this stupid argument about 'transgenderism' and accept what we truly are! A woman is a woman and she will always be one. Her biological sex has no bearing whatsoever on whether or not she is a girl or a boy. Her gender is what really matters and nothing more. That is why I'm proud to call myself a woman, because I am what I am. Not a man and not an ape, just me. And that is something that you can never take from me. Never forget that.
And I know many will disagree with me because some people will spread lies that are so blatantly false that we need a new generation of activists who want to bring the truth out into the open. Chuds, nazis and extremists alike will tell us to shut up and go back to hiding under our rock. Well tough luck because we're not going anywhere anytime soon. We'll stay right where we are and fight until our blood is red. Because we have a right to exist. The world owes us justice.

They are suddenly terrified of any overlap at all between the sexes, they have to be ultra divided and different in every way, and if someone doesn't act that way it has to be corrected as soon as possible. I suppose opposites attract and since they idolize sex and marriage and raising a family as the ultimate, they want everyone to fall in line to make the "perfect" families and a "strong" society. That in itself already exposes the true motive: reproduction and propagation of the clan and species. Which means they're actually following biological instincts and using religion to justify it.

Even my own family has started dropping judgy comments any time we're in public and someone does something not typical of their gender. I never saw this before, then like a year ago it appeared out of nowhere and everyone was blindly agreeing with it.

parent.body:
Hmm, it's funny how we are complaining about opposite things. I think both are over-reactions against the other. Like, you can be all A or all B without having to think, but striking the proper balance between them is what's worthwhile yet difficult.

People will go through all sorts of contortions to avoid having to think for themselves. TBF it can be pretty hard work sometimes :p

body:
> marriage (it's important, properly understood)

It's literally treated like the ultimate purpose and if you're still not married and making babies by a certain age you're considered immature at best. For example:

"Let me tell you the most devastating attack on marriage today is coming from singleness. Singleness is an assault on marriage. Marriage is the grace of life. As a pastor, I tell my people, "Look, if it keeps going this way, I'm gonna line all the girls on one side, all the guys on the other, we're gonna just match you up and have a huge wedding." This escalating self-preoccupation, personal ambition, personal development . . . that creates a kind of terminal singleness is devastating on obviously the family. . . . I just see singleness as a disaster." - John MacArthur, the de-facto pope of Protestantism

And I can confirm seeing this attitude. The data can testify too, with people who go to church regularly marrying younger, being more likely to marry, having more kids, etc.

> historical figures

Catholic saints are included. Protestants are just as bad if not worse with the founding fathers. And both idolize philosophers and Bible characters.

> complementarianism (men and women are different, complementarianism can try to act like they're equal at times)

*Complementarianism* tries to act like they're equal? Complementarianism is the doctrine insisting men and women purposely strive to keep themselves distinct in every way and "act like their gender", and if someone has any trait at all considered more typical of the other sex then they're being a tranny, which is apparently the worst thing a person can possibly do.

> tradition (bad traditions can go, good can stay)

If it weren't an idol then people wouldn't be so attatched to the bad ones

> stoicism (some of the philosophy overlaps with Christianity I think, some doesn't seem to)

Many people value it because of the parts which are opposite of the fruits of the spirit, but appeal to human nature. Women in particular find it attractive. Coldness and ruthlessness are encouraged in a leader and equated with strength.

> strong ruthless leaders (Jesus wasn't necessarily "aggressive" but was neither excessively wrathful nor idle)

Well a lot of people talk about it constantly, and it's more common among religious folks because they can use religion to justify anything. Human nature is most comfortable with aggressive, authoritarian, and vengeful leaders. It means giving up your autonomy but you'll be safer. And you'll likely get to see your enemies suffer, which is evil af but humans absolutely love it. The vast majority of humans would choose Caesar over Jesus any day.

Oh, I mean some people say that men and women are "equal", but that they are different and "complement each other". But yeah I can see where some people might "overemphasize" gender differences as well.

So you think they should be unequally different too?

Interesting, as I only ever see men talk about it online, but women could be putting some of those things in to practice, sure.

They like it for the same reason people in general like it in leaders: it makes them seem like better providers and protectors. Submission fetishes are also very common in women.

Interesting, as I only ever see men talk about it online, but women could be putting some of those things in to practice, sure.
